body_text.sentence: Considering the limitations for diagnosing and timing encephalopathies in the preterm newborn, this review defines Neonatal encephalopathy as a clinical syndrome presenting with abnormal functioning of the central nervous system, in the earliest days of life in an newborn (up to 28 days of life) born at or beyond 35 weeks of gestation, manifested by an abnormal level of alertness or seizures, and often accompanied by difficulty with initiating and maintaining respiration and depression of tone that may be due to a variety of etiologies including hypoxia/ischemia, metabolic disturbance, or infection.
